FK.content: origin of repetition: division of the same
no to-come w/out iterability, w/out heritage & possibility of repeating, w/out messianic memory and promise, messiancity more originary than all messianism, opens the worst
FK.linkedContent: no to-come w/out iterability, w/out heritage & possibility of repeating, w/out messianic memory and promise, messiancity more originary than all messianism, opens the worst

AF.content: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive
AF.linkedContent: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive

AF.content: archive always holds a problem for translation, it is repeatable and idiomatic
AF.linkedContent: archive always holds a problem for translation, it is repeatable and idiomatic

SPOM.content: question of repetition, specter is always a revenant, can’t control its comings and goings > commence par revenir
SPOM.linkedContent: question of repetition, specter is always a revenant, can’t control its comings and goings > commence par revenir

SPOM.content: deconstruction never been (non) Marxist, faithful to a certain spirit of Marxism > il y en a plus d’un et ils son hétérogènes [this can never be repeated too often (on ne le répétera jamais assez)]
SPOM.linkedContent: deconstruction never been (non) Marxist, faithful to a certain spirit of Marxism > il y en a plus d’un et ils son hétérogènes [this can never be repeated too often (on ne le répétera jamais assez)]

SPOM.content: “absolute proximity of a stranger whose power is singular and anonymous (es spukt),” unnameable, neutral power > this, which we have said nothing determinable urgently returns, insists, gives one to think, irresistible anguish, like that of future and death, doesn’t stem from but produces automatism of repetition alongside principle of reason > tout autre est tout autre ——nous faisant régulièrement parler depuis le lieu où nous ne voulons rien dire, où nous savons clairement ce que nous ne voulons pas dire mais ne savons pas ce que nous voudrions dire, comme si cela n'était plus ni de l'ordre du savoir ni de l'ordre du vouloir ou du vouloir-dire
SPOM.linkedContent: “absolute proximity of a stranger whose power is singular and anonymous (es spukt),” unnameable, neutral power > this, which we have said nothing determinable urgently returns, insists, gives one to think, irresistible anguish, like that of future and death, doesn’t stem from but produces automatism of repetition alongside principle of reason > tout autre est tout autre ——nous faisant régulièrement parler depuis le lieu où nous ne voulons rien dire, où nous savons clairement ce que nous ne voulons pas dire mais ne savons pas ce que nous voudrions dire, comme si cela n'était plus ni de l'ordre du savoir ni de l'ordre du vouloir ou du vouloir-dire

HASD.content: prayer, quotation of prayer, & apostrophe weave same text > there is a text because of this repetition, this place is the event, future of what is promised, initiated, not motionless like khora
HASD.linkedContent: prayer, quotation of prayer, & apostrophe weave same text > there is a text because of this repetition, this place is the event, future of what is promised, initiated, not motionless like khora

MPM.content: de Man on Baudelaire: représentation du présent [re: memory of present] combines incompatibility of repetitive & instantaneous pattern (tension); Baudelaire faithful to seduction of the present; for him, memory applies more to present that past
MPM.linkedContent: de Man on Baudelaire: représentation du présent [re: memory of present] combines incompatibility of repetitive & instantaneous pattern (tension); Baudelaire faithful to seduction of the present; for him, memory applies more to present that past

POOF.content: future is not just the new, but the work of the arch-ancient, repetition
POOF.linkedContent: future is not just the new, but the work of the arch-ancient, repetition

POOF.content: desire for one single friendship exposes possibility & impossibility of indivisible calculation: one time for all time(s) will never cease, immediately infinite in its finiteness, appears as such only in unceasing desire for repetition/multiplication [cf. Augustine in Confessions] > the subject, the ‘one’ friend is indivisible in its calculable identity, indivisible in its incalculable singularity, the one divides the other: it is here that the enemy is w/in the friend
POOF.linkedContent: desire for one single friendship exposes possibility & impossibility of indivisible calculation: one time for all time(s) will never cease, immediately infinite in its finiteness, appears as such only in unceasing desire for repetition/multiplication [cf. Augustine in Confessions] > the subject, the ‘one’ friend is indivisible in its calculable identity, indivisible in its incalculable singularity, the one divides the other: it is here that the enemy is w/in the friend

SEC.content: iter (from itara, other, in Sanskrit) > everything that links otherness to repetition
SEC.linkedContent: iter (from itara, other, in Sanskrit) > everything that links otherness to repetition

SEC.content: no context, no code can enclose written syntagma > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)
SEC.linkedContent: no context, no code can enclose written syntagma > code: possibility/impossibility of writing, of its essential iterability (repetition/alterity)

PP.content: writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])
PP.linkedContent: writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])

PP.content: Thoth puts play into play, repeats in play of supplement, his propriety or property is impropriety, inappropriateness, floating indetermination allows for substitution and play
PP.linkedContent: Thoth puts play into play, repeats in play of supplement, his propriety or property is impropriety, inappropriateness, floating indetermination allows for substitution and play

PP.content: Thoth, god of resurrection, interested in death as a repetition of life, life as a rehearsal for death
PP.linkedContent: Thoth, god of resurrection, interested in death as a repetition of life, life as a rehearsal for death

PP.content: once there’s a supplement, there’s a supplement of a supplement (this is its structure); Plato fears this fatal entrainment, though it’s linked to eidos as possibility of repetition of same
PP.linkedContent: once there’s a supplement, there’s a supplement of a supplement (this is its structure); Plato fears this fatal entrainment, though it’s linked to eidos as possibility of repetition of same

PP.content: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak
PP.linkedContent: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak

PP.content: writing can only repeat its own hollowness, subject already knows signifieds, gives them to writing on consignment
PP.linkedContent: writing can only repeat its own hollowness, subject already knows signifieds, gives them to writing on consignment

PP.content: writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living
PP.linkedContent: writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living

PP.content: God true father of the bed, the clinical eidos, carpenter, demiurge, repeats eidos, painter does not generate anything, imitates
PP.linkedContent: God true father of the bed, the clinical eidos, carpenter, demiurge, repeats eidos, painter does not generate anything, imitates

PP.content: no repetition possible w/out graphics of supplementarity, supplies for lack of full unity, being enough the same and enough the other to replace by addition (en ajoutant)
PP.linkedContent: no repetition possible w/out graphics of supplementarity, supplies for lack of full unity, being enough the same and enough the other to replace by addition (en ajoutant)

PP.content: two tautologies, repetitions: 1) life coming back to itself: eidos, logos, mnēmē, phōnē, requires dialectics, didactics 2) life going out of itself beyond return, unreserved spending, irreducible excess, play of supplement [can’t think these apart from one another]
PP.linkedContent: two tautologies, repetitions: 1) life coming back to itself: eidos, logos, mnēmē, phōnē, requires dialectics, didactics 2) life going out of itself beyond return, unreserved spending, irreducible excess, play of supplement [can’t think these apart from one another]

VP.content: [see Aquinas’ 2<sup><small>nd</small></sup> way] repetition comes first and last (no unified origin, no final end)
VP.linkedContent: [see Aquinas’ 2nd way] repetition comes first and last (no unified origin, no final end)

VP.content: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]
VP.linkedContent: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]

VP.content: maintenance btwn reality and representation, presence and repetition, an obstinate desire to remain secured, assured, constituted in the face of repetition
VP.linkedContent: maintenance btwn reality and representation, presence and repetition, an obstinate desire to remain secured, assured, constituted in the face of repetition

VP.content: against Husserl, we make Vorstellung depend on repetition, and presentation (Gegenwärtigung) depend on re-presentation, we derive presence-of-the-present form repetition (not the reverse)
VP.linkedContent: against Husserl, we make Vorstellung depend on repetition, and presentation (Gegenwärtigung) depend on re-presentation, we derive presence-of-the-present form repetition (not the reverse)

VP.content: absolute ideality is correlate of a possibility of indefinite repetition of the same > being for Husserl is ideality as repetition
VP.linkedContent: absolute ideality is correlate of a possibility of indefinite repetition of the same > being for Husserl is ideality as repetition

VP.content: tradition assured to infinity > transmission and reactivation of origin; this is a valuation, an ethico-theoretical act, reawakening originary decision of philosophy as Platonic form
VP.linkedContent: tradition assured to infinity > transmission and reactivation of origin; this is a valuation, an ethico-theoretical act, reawakening originary decision of philosophy as Platonic form

VP.content: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same
VP.linkedContent: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same

VP.content: the more the signifier is ideal, more it augments potency of repetition of presence, the more it protects, preserves, reserves and capitalizes on sense
VP.linkedContent: the more the signifier is ideal, more it augments potency of repetition of presence, the more it protects, preserves, reserves and capitalizes on sense

PAS.content: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none > viens never arrives because of this repetition
PAS.linkedContent: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none > viens never arrives because of this repetition

PAS.content: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt
PAS.linkedContent: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt

PAS.content: the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now of récit]
PAS.linkedContent: the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now of récit]

S.content: performing as Heidegger, Derrida affirms [?] Heidegger’s rigorous repetition [not hollow], which crosses path of tout autre [re: attempt to move beyond Christianity]
S.linkedContent: performing as Heidegger, Derrida affirms [?] Heidegger’s rigorous repetition [not hollow], which crosses path of tout autre [re: attempt to move beyond Christianity]

FSW.content: “repetition”—death as power, lack of power—institutes translatability, makes possible “language,” transforms absolute idiom into a limit toujours déjà transgressed (pure idiom is not language, becomes so only through repetition), repetition divides point of departure of first time; however, to only look at effect of repetition, at translation, obvious distinction btwn force & meaning, effaces intensity of death drive
FSW.linkedContent: “repetition”—death as power, lack of power—institutes translatability, makes possible “language,” transforms absolute idiom into a limit toujours déjà transgressed (pure idiom is not language, becomes so only through repetition), repetition divides point of departure of first time; however, to only look at effect of repetition, at translation, obvious distinction btwn force & meaning, effaces intensity of death drive

FSW.content: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility
FSW.linkedContent: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility

PPHS.content: [Hegel on calculation and machine] a “living,” “thinking,” “speaking” protest against repetition
PPHS.linkedContent: [Hegel on calculation and machine] a “living,” “thinking,” “speaking” protest against repetition

TC.content: Artaud wants to do away w/ repetition, but a repetition more in the vein of what Derrida would call calculable: dialectic, God, Being; for Artaud, God’s death (Jesus) imposed difference and repetition in life > menacing life
TC.linkedContent: Artaud wants to do away w/ repetition, but a repetition more in the vein of what Derrida would call calculable: dialectic, God, Being; for Artaud, God’s death (Jesus) imposed difference and repetition in life > menacing life

TC.content: dialectics as economy of repetition, economy of truth, movement by which expenditure is reappropriated into presence [Being and dialectics? eternal repetition]
TC.linkedContent: dialectics as economy of repetition, economy of truth, movement by which expenditure is reappropriated into presence [Being and dialectics? eternal repetition]

TC.content: idea of impossible theater of cruelty [Master Morality], w/out representation, which begins in repetition, doesn’t help regulate theatrical practice but helps conceive of its origin, limit, horizon of its death > Western theater encompassed w/in its own possibility, but repetition steals its center
TC.linkedContent: idea of impossible theater of cruelty [Master Morality], w/out representation, which begins in repetition, doesn’t help regulate theatrical practice but helps conceive of its origin, limit, horizon of its death > Western theater encompassed w/in its own possibility, but repetition steals its center

TC.content: affirmation must be penetrated in repeating itself > murder of father is endless, repeated indefinitely [murder of father: presence representing itself, i.e. a sign, a repetition]
TC.linkedContent: affirmation must be penetrated in repeating itself > murder of father is endless, repeated indefinitely [murder of father: presence representing itself, i.e. a sign, a repetition]

SH.content: date repeats its unrepeatability: divides in repeating, enciphers, encrypts itself, effaces to become readable, unreadable in its readability
SH.linkedContent: date repeats its unrepeatability: divides in repeating, enciphers, encrypts itself, effaces to become readable, unreadable in its readability

F.content: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve
F.linkedContent: crypt is a parasite inclusion/internalization, an inside heterogenous to inside of Self, an outcast in domain of introjection w/in which it violently takes its place, le for cryptique entretiens dans la répétition the mortal conflict it is impotent to resolve

DS.content: specularity of eidos > logos—speech < mirroring [repetition ordered by resemblance (homoiōsis), doubling as duplication]
DS.linkedContent: specularity of eidos > logos—speech < mirroring [repetition ordered by resemblance (homoiōsis), doubling as duplication]

DS.content: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]
DS.linkedContent: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]

DS.content: Derrida always returning to Freud’s Das Unheimliche (1919)—double, repetition, blurring of borders btwn “imagination” & “reality,” “symbol” & “thing it symbolizes”
DS.linkedContent: Derrida always returning to Freud’s Das Unheimliche (1919)—double, repetition, blurring of borders btwn “imagination” & “reality,” “symbol” & “thing it symbolizes”

DS.content: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture
DS.linkedContent: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture

DS.content: “re-presentation” [Derrida via Mallarmé]: less concerned with setting forth things, the image of things, than setting up a machine > repetition-toward-itself of text as re-folding
DS.linkedContent: “re-presentation” [Derrida via Mallarmé]: less concerned with setting forth things, the image of things, than setting up a machine > repetition-toward-itself of text as re-folding

DS.content: hymen is not a phenomenon—it folds itself back into the antre, which is an abyss
DS.linkedContent: hymen is not a phenomenon—it folds itself back into the antre, which is an abyss

DS.content: mark upon mark, text w/in text, margin in mark (endless repeat): an abyss
DS.linkedContent: mark upon mark, text w/in text, margin in mark (endless repeat): an abyss

DS.content: writing en abyme, abyss will never have glint (l’éclat) of phenomenon > becomes white or black, l’un et/ou l’autre au carré de l’écriture
DS.linkedContent: writing en abyme, abyss will never have glint (l’éclat) of phenomenon > becomes white or black, l’un et/ou l’autre au carré de l’écriture

POS.content: dissemination via death drive links new concept of repetition to value of mimesis
POS.linkedContent: dissemination via death drive links new concept of repetition to value of mimesis

P.content: wanting to avoid “repetition” at all costs, one can: rush toward false exit, empirical chit-chat (bavardage), spring-green impulsive avant-gardism (l’avant-gardism printanier ou primesautier)
P.linkedContent: wanting to avoid “repetition” at all costs, one can: rush toward false exit, empirical chit-chat (bavardage), spring-green impulsive avant-gardism (l’avant-gardism printanier ou primesautier)

P.content: who said it was necessary to avoid risk of “repetition”?
P.linkedContent: who said it was necessary to avoid risk of “repetition”?

OS.content: pleasure one takes in repetition ultimately cannot appear before tribunal of any law > the limit of such a tribunal—philosophy—is in question here
OS.linkedContent: pleasure one takes in repetition ultimately cannot appear before tribunal of any law > the limit of such a tribunal—philosophy—is in question here

ROP.content: death drive and repetition compulsion (Wiederholungszwang), hyperbolic resistance of nonresistance, “resistance of the unconscious,” thwarts working through, une résistance qui n’a pas de sens (death drive), n’est pas une résistance > [does this concept present analysis itself? is it the structure of analysis? does it fold over? upset the meaning of the series?]
ROP.linkedContent: death drive and repetition compulsion (Wiederholungszwang), hyperbolic resistance of nonresistance, “resistance of the unconscious,” thwarts working through, une résistance qui n’a pas de sens (death drive), n’est pas une résistance > [does this concept present analysis itself? is it the structure of analysis? does it fold over? upset the meaning of the series?]

ATIA.content: one should try not to repeat oneself, it gives appearance of training (dressage), of following a program
ATIA.linkedContent: one should try not to repeat oneself, it gives appearance of training (dressage), of following a program

ATIA.content: we’ll have to move continuously along the coming & going btwn the oldest & what is coming > the “again (de nouveau)” and “anew (à nouveau)” of repetition
ATIA.linkedContent: we’ll have to move continuously along the coming & going btwn the oldest & what is coming > the “again (de nouveau)” and “anew (à nouveau)” of repetition

Gii.content: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein
Gii.linkedContent: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein

DST.content: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)
DST.linkedContent: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)

PIO.content: “Fable” has status of invention, from double position of author/reader, signatory/countersignatory, insofar as it proposes a machine, tekhnē, a self-quoting invention, a printing matrix > process w/out beginning or end, an exergue as impossible as it is necessary
PIO.linkedContent: “Fable” has status of invention, from double position of author/reader, signatory/countersignatory, insofar as it proposes a machine, tekhnē, a self-quoting invention, a printing matrix > process w/out beginning or end, an exergue as impossible as it is necessary

RM.content: via Ereignis, re- of retrait no accident, no accident occurring to trait, does not appear, no proper, structurally in withdrawal: gap, trace, border, traction, effraction, differentiality
RM.linkedContent: via Ereignis, re- of retrait no accident, no accident occurring to trait, does not appear, no proper, structurally in withdrawal: gap, trace, border, traction, effraction, differentiality

RM.content: repetition of incision stated violently in Riss, Ent-Ziehung, Ent-fernung, and in the Enteignen (rectraction of propriety) that hollows out every Ereignis
RM.linkedContent: repetition of incision stated violently in Riss, Ent-Ziehung, Ent-fernung, and in the Enteignen (rectraction of propriety) that hollows out every Ereignis

AFR.content: both Condillac and de Biran take repetition for granted, rule of indecision never comes to conception (au concept), a limit which is the concept not a concept: thus, Condillac finds contradiction in activity/passivity, de Biran duplicity in Condillac’s “hesitation”
AFR.linkedContent: both Condillac and de Biran take repetition for granted, rule of indecision never comes to conception (au concept), a limit which is the concept not a concept: thus, Condillac finds contradiction in activity/passivity, de Biran duplicity in Condillac’s “hesitation”

AFR.content: innovation as revelation, analysis as analogical process, energy connecting present to absent > concept of force as force of repetition (retracing, supplying)
AFR.linkedContent: innovation as revelation, analysis as analogical process, energy connecting present to absent > concept of force as force of repetition (retracing, supplying)

AFR.content: Derrida sees here a silent explosion in text or fission in each concept (Condillac, elsewhere, denounces obscurantist force of “metaphor” [hence analogical value])
AFR.linkedContent: Derrida sees here a silent explosion in text or fission in each concept (Condillac, elsewhere, denounces obscurantist force of “metaphor” [hence analogical value])

AFR.content: repetitive structure of knowing gives rise to archeological interpretation of frivolous & to a metaphysics of plagiarism [Derrida quotes Condillac on plagiarism]
AFR.linkedContent: repetitive structure of knowing gives rise to archeological interpretation of frivolous & to a metaphysics of plagiarism [Derrida quotes Condillac on plagiarism]

AFR.content: for Condillac, there is no difference in general, only of degrees > this proposition comes to unfold (déplier) all concepts of rupture/repetition, this unfolding is time’s
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, there is no difference in general, only of degrees > this proposition comes to unfold (déplier) all concepts of rupture/repetition, this unfolding is time’s

AFR.content: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation

D.content: to write means to graft (same word), each grafted text radiates toward the site of its removal, s’y régénèrent dans la répétition, à la bordure d’un surjet (overcast seam)
D.linkedContent: to write means to graft (same word), each grafted text radiates toward the site of its removal, s’y régénèrent dans la répétition, à la bordure d’un surjet (overcast seam)

D.content: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]
D.linkedContent: discrete violence of incision not apparent in thickness of text [cf. EJQB p. 78]

D.content: the unique (that which is not repeated—thus, has no unity), the inummerable, call it the present, is thus apeiron, the unlimited, the crowd, the imperfect
D.linkedContent: the unique (that which is not repeated—thus, has no unity), the inummerable, call it the present, is thus apeiron, the unlimited, the crowd, the imperfect

D.content: only that which can be repeated in its identity can have unity
D.linkedContent: only that which can be repeated in its identity can have unity

NOY.content: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)
NOY.linkedContent: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)

NOY.content: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”
NOY.linkedContent: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”

NOY.content: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”
NOY.linkedContent: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”

EL.content: return, repetition, revenance, the re- in language, as language insofar as it inaugurates possibility of revenge in language
EL.linkedContent: return, repetition, revenance, the re- in language, as language insofar as it inaugurates possibility of revenge in language

LI.content: logical force of iter: ties repetition to alterity
LI.linkedContent: logical force of iter: ties repetition to alterity

LI.content: “I repeat…it can never be repeated too often”: absence of receiver from sender, structural necessity that makes writing possible
LI.linkedContent: “I repeat…it can never be repeated too often”: absence of receiver from sender, structural necessity that makes writing possible

LI.content: phenomenon of repeatability is condition of possibility of survival of text [not vice versa]
LI.linkedContent: phenomenon of repeatability is condition of possibility of survival of text [not vice versa]

LI.content: coupure intervenes moment there’s a mark, its positive condition of emergence, it is iterability itself, that which is remarkable in mark, re- of repeated, re- of repeating, condition/effect of iterability, merges w/it, cuts across (recoupe) iterability, cutting the cut/break in remark
LI.linkedContent: coupure intervenes moment there’s a mark, its positive condition of emergence, it is iterability itself, that which is remarkable in mark, re- of repeated, re- of repeating, condition/effect of iterability, merges w/it, cuts across (recoupe) iterability, cutting the cut/break in remark

LI.content: unity of signifying form due to its iterability, possibility of being repeated in absence of a determinate signified
LI.linkedContent: unity of signifying form due to its iterability, possibility of being repeated in absence of a determinate signified

LI.content: repeatability of both (identificatory) iterability & (altering) iterability > necessity of thinking rule & event, concept & singularity, at once
LI.linkedContent: repeatability of both (identificatory) iterability & (altering) iterability > necessity of thinking rule & event, concept & singularity, at once

LI.content: iterability thus a concept that renders possible the silhouette of ideality, & hence the concept, hence all distinction > marks the limit of idealization/conceptualization: “concept” or quasiconcept of concept in its conceptualizable relation to nonconcept
LI.linkedContent: iterability thus a concept that renders possible the silhouette of ideality, & hence the concept, hence all distinction > marks the limit of idealization/conceptualization: “concept” or quasiconcept of concept in its conceptualizable relation to nonconcept

ATM.content: inconsolable slowness of gift, as if necessary to delay the endless falling due (échéance) of repetition
ATM.linkedContent: inconsolable slowness of gift, as if necessary to delay the endless falling due (échéance) of repetition

WOG.content: the non-discursive remainder, the resistance of the pharmakon, exceeds (is not only) the simulacrum or phantasm—whose repetition disorganizes dialectic
WOG.linkedContent: the non-discursive remainder, the resistance of the pharmakon, exceeds (is not only) the simulacrum or phantasm—whose repetition disorganizes dialectic

OG.content: internal modification of phonocentrism (or logocentrism): Descartes’ cogito interiorizes ideality of eidos & substantiality of ousia; thereafter, objectivity takes form of representation, idea becomes modification of self-present substance, power of repetition in eidos/ousia acquires absolute independence, a substance in relation w/ itself, res cogitans, consciousness—auto-affection, lumière naturelle > surmounts the Evil Genius (Malin Génie)
OG.linkedContent: internal modification of phonocentrism (or logocentrism): Descartes’ cogito interiorizes ideality of eidos & substantiality of ousia; thereafter, objectivity takes form of representation, idea becomes modification of self-present substance, power of repetition in eidos/ousia acquires absolute independence, a substance in relation w/ itself, res cogitans, consciousness—auto-affection, lumière naturelle > surmounts the Evil Genius (Malin Génie)

OG.content: auto-affection, universal structure of experience, being capable of being affected by other, capable of symbolizing, another name for “life,” the as-for-itself or for-itself: subjectivity—gains in its mastery of the other to the extent that its power of repetition idealizes itself (s’idéalise) > the external, the signifier, becomes my spontaneity, and escapes me less and less
OG.linkedContent: auto-affection, universal structure of experience, being capable of being affected by other, capable of symbolizing, another name for “life,” the as-for-itself or for-itself: subjectivity—gains in its mastery of the other to the extent that its power of repetition idealizes itself (s’idéalise) > the external, the signifier, becomes my spontaneity, and escapes me less and less

OG.content: for Rousseau, fear induces magnification that makes man speak [cf. 351n Vico]; [repetition of instrumental fear: aidez-moi (Northern need)] anguish & repetition
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, fear induces magnification that makes man speak [cf. 351n Vico]; [repetition of instrumental fear: aidez-moi (Northern need)] anguish & repetition

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself

SPEC.content: Wiederholungszwang (repetition compulsion) put in communication w/ death drive

repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance
SPEC.linkedContent: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance

SPEC.content: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time

SPEC.content: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic
SPEC.linkedContent: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic

SPEC.content: repetition as reproduction, reproduction of life-death, wiedererleben, poses no problem [to Freud] as long as satisfaction is found elsewhere [i.e. nothing beyond PP]
SPEC.linkedContent: repetition as reproduction, reproduction of life-death, wiedererleben, poses no problem [to Freud] as long as satisfaction is found elsewhere [i.e. nothing beyond PP]

SPEC.content: all the interlacings of fort:da, tout ce qui s’envoi in graphics of repetition that dislocates summary “triangle” > le trait oedipien n’est qu’une rection pour le fil conducteur de la bobine [Oedipus most narrowly restricted effects of above repetition’s graphics]
SPEC.linkedContent: all the interlacings of fort:da, tout ce qui s’envoi in graphics of repetition that dislocates summary “triangle” > le trait oedipien n’est qu’une rection pour le fil conducteur de la bobine [Oedipus most narrowly restricted effects of above repetition’s graphics]

SPEC.content: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices
SPEC.linkedContent: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices

SPEC.content: déclencheur (trigger-effect) of the déchaînement, unbinding, destricturation > repetition compulsion & death drive unbind from all contracture
SPEC.linkedContent: déclencheur (trigger-effect) of the déchaînement, unbinding, destricturation > repetition compulsion & death drive unbind from all contracture

SPEC.content: tendency to stricturing (binding, mastering) foreshadows PP w/out being it, everything en différance de stricture > repetition itself > but there never is repetition itself > allure of this more or less tightened lace
SPEC.linkedContent: tendency to stricturing (binding, mastering) foreshadows PP w/out being it, everything en différance de stricture > repetition itself > but there never is repetition itself > allure of this more or less tightened lace

SPEC.content: repetition secondary in classical logic, “original” in general deconstruction
Ab-bauen [sometimes translated as “to deconstruct,” cf. p. 267]: repetition haunts the PP
SPEC.linkedContent: Ab-bauen [sometimes translated as “to deconstruct,” cf. p. 267]: repetition haunts the PP

SPEC.content: Plato’s pharmacy [also PP]: “one repetition repeats the other” > there is no “sometimes…sometimes”
SPEC.linkedContent: Plato’s pharmacy [also PP]: “one repetition repeats the other” > there is no “sometimes…sometimes”

SPEC.content: 2 repetitions (2 logics) as constitutive duplicity, double bind
if there’s any chance of reading illegible text as illegible: must take incalculable double bind (bande) of PP into account
SPEC.linkedContent: if there’s any chance of reading illegible text as illegible: must take incalculable double bind (bande) of PP into account

SPEC.content: normal repetition: idealizing interiorization, mastery (Hegel, Husserl)
SPEC.linkedContent: normal repetition: idealizing interiorization, mastery (Hegel, Husserl)

SPEC.content: for Freud, adults should tend toward novelty > compulsively repetitive demand is beyond the PP, adult acts like child
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, adults should tend toward novelty > compulsively repetitive demand is beyond the PP, adult acts like child

SPEC.content: thus far in Beyond… [chapter 3?], differential stricture of repetition has not demanded a word about death
SPEC.linkedContent: thus far in Beyond… [chapter 3?], differential stricture of repetition has not demanded a word about death

SPEC.content: power (posts) as transcendental predicate (not to be confused w/ death drive or repetition compulsion, gives us w/ what to describe them) > still, though borrowing descriptive traits from Bemächtigung, death drive & repetition compulsion overflow power > there is only differance of power, whence the posts, “will to power” [?]
SPEC.linkedContent: power (posts) as transcendental predicate (not to be confused w/ death drive or repetition compulsion, gives us w/ what to describe them) > still, though borrowing descriptive traits from Bemächtigung, death drive & repetition compulsion overflow power > there is only differance of power, whence the posts, “will to power” [?]

FV.content: Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]
FV.linkedContent: Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]

FV.content: psychoanalysis [Freud, Bonaparte] justifies crushing monotony of monosemic truth under heading Wiederholungszwang [i.e. Freud declaring sun another sublimated symbol of father]
FV.linkedContent: psychoanalysis [Freud, Bonaparte] justifies crushing monotony of monosemic truth under heading Wiederholungszwang [i.e. Freud declaring sun another sublimated symbol of father]

FV.content: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
FV.linkedContent: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]

FV.content: [vis-à-vis Lacan] present speech, anamnesis, irreplaceable properness, inalienable singularity > disqualification of recording or repetition in the name of the act of living (present speech): a well known program
FV.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Lacan] present speech, anamnesis, irreplaceable properness, inalienable singularity > disqualification of recording or repetition in the name of the act of living (present speech): a well known program

WBH.content: to receive a gift, in Nietzschean sense, is to say, “I want to begin again,” not a reproduction: “yes” of gift must be repeatable from the start
WBH.linkedContent: to receive a gift, in Nietzschean sense, is to say, “I want to begin again,” not a reproduction: “yes” of gift must be repeatable from the start
